message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CV. 

This paper is about evaluating the output of machine translation systems, specifically at the document level. This falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP), which is typically classified under cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the use of neural machine translation (NMT) suggests a focus on machine learning (ML), which could fall under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) or cs.LG (Machine Learning). The evaluation of discourse phenomena could also involve information retrieval (IR) techniques, which could fall under cs.IR (Information Retrieval). Finally, the use of NMT for document-level translations could involve computer vision (CV) techniques for image-to-text translations, which could fall under cs.CV (Computer Vision).
